summary: This is an email chain from November 15, 2019, regarding press inquiries related to the Epstein case. A representative from the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner requests contact information for the press official handling Epstein matters, intending to connect them with their Director of Public Affairs, Aja Worthy-Davis. The email is forwarded to Nicholas Biase and James Margolin from the U.S. Attorney's Office press team.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.role: Press Office Staff (US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
persons.context: Copied on an email regarding press inquiries for the Epstein case from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: James Margolin
persons.role: Press Office Staff (US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
persons.context: Copied on an email regarding press inquiries for the Epstein case from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Aja Worthy-Davis
persons.role: Director of Public Affairs (NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner)
persons.context: Identified as the person responding to press inquiries for the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner regarding the Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are copied on the same email from the U.S. Attorney's Office press team regarding Epstein case press inquiries.
The email seeks to connect Aja Worthy-Davis with the press official (implied to be Biase or Margolin) handling Epstein matters for the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The email seeks to connect Aja Worthy-Davis with the press official (implied to be Biase or Margolin) handling Epstein matters for the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Press Inquiry Coordination for Epstein Case
events.description: The New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner reaches out to the U.S. Attorney's Office to coordinate press responses regarding the Epstein case.

locations.context: Address of the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, the sender of the initial inquiry.

keyFacts: The New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner was actively fielding press inquiries related to the Epstein case as of November 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had designated press officials (Nicholas Biase and James Margolin) to handle Epstein-related media matters.
The communication shows inter-agency coordination on public communications regarding the Epstein investigation post his death.
